intro: Antiphytum geoffreyi, commonly known as the Geoffrey's antiphytum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its water-storing tissues. Antiphytum geoffreyi is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and resilience.
